summary: Pink Floyd is an English rock band formed in 1965 in London. They started as a psychedelic group and became famous for their long songs, experimental sounds, thoughtful lyrics, and amazing live shows. The original members were Syd Barrett, Nick Mason, Roger Waters, and Richard Wright. David Gilmour joined in 1967, and Barrett left due to health issues. Waters wrote most of their popular songs and concepts for albums like "The Dark Side of the Moon" and "The Wall." The band faced changes in members but continued to create music and perform until the 2000s. They've sold over 250 million records and won many awards, including Grammy Hall of Fame inductions.
title: Pink Floyd
